attributes.action: GOVERNMENT TO SUSPEND THE M.I.F FOR SELF-EMPLOYED UNTIL APR 2021 TO HELP PEOPLE
attributes.additional_details:
The 'Minimum Income Floor' (MIF) - which affects an estimated 450,000 self-employed UC claimants - was suspended for eight months due to Covid-19.

But that reprieve is currently set to expire on November 12, and ministers still haven't confirmed if it will be extended.
attributes.background: WE DEMAND THE GOVERNMENT TO SUSPEND THE MINIMUM INCOME FLOOR (M.I.F) FOR SELF-EMPLOYED UNTIL APRIL 2021 TO GIVE RELIEF TO 450,000 PEOPLE ACROSS UK DURING THIS PANDEMIC.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552461
